Reviews.Title: “SWEET!”
Reviews.Author: 5dayweekend
Reviews.Content: Short stay in Oct 2011 just after opening. What a cool hotel. Not the normal adjective I use for hotels. The decor was very contemporary and soothing. The rooms were obviously retro fitted from renovation, but very cool. First time to Chicago. We enjoyed the exceptional hospitality and customer minded attitude. We ate breakfast at the in house restaurant-AWESOME!!!!! The food was EXCELLENT!!!! The waiter made note that the clear coffee mugs were not holding heat well enough from customer feed back -so they were changing them and apologized in the mean time......since when do restaurants skip image for practicality? The in room option to buy drawer was something new for us to experience- not your standard beer,water and snacks. The only downside was the mattress- the platform bed was uber cool but hard as a rock!!!! The area was very nice, we walked around (my husband went for a run) without concern and the area is stunning for the price! Be prepare to pay hefty overnight parking any where in Chicago ; (. Will definately stay again if we go back!

Reviews.Title: “St.Pat's weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kevin B
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in the hotel bar, the warm cookies went well with the Martin's! Very short walk to Michigan Ave past all the Rush St places on our way back and had a lot of green beer. The service was outstanding. The room was small but well done and the bed was perfect. Booked a room for the 4th July already!

Reviews.Title: “PUBLIC - Chicago”
Reviews.Author: dan c
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very cool spot. Nice rooms, solid service. I would most certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: klenc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property a few years ago when it was the Ambassador East. I left after one night because of the small room size (we had 2 kids with us) and the rude service. Decided to give the new ownership a try because of its location close to Rush/Division Street bars on St Patrick's Day weekend. A previous post hit the nail on the head. This is a refurbished property not a renovated one. The lobby, bars and resturant are very modern. Check in was efficient. Asked for a room with a view - got a room on the eight floor with a view of the fire escape stairs, looking into the windows of another room on the 8th floor (hotel is an L shape configuration). Manager said this was best available. Ice machines are on the 8th and 17 th floors only. In a building with old elevators this could be an inconvenience. I get what the decorators were trying to do. Everything in the room is of small scale - apartment size furniture, platform bed (about 12 inches off the floor) , shelving all at a low level tying to give the space a taller feeling, small desk with small uncomfortable chair with a sheepskin throw on the chair. (Really - do I want to sit on a sheepskin and have white fuzzies all over my clothes? ) Room had a fine layter of dust on the furniture (evident because some of the furniture is black. Temperature is controlled by a wall thermostat - but that is somehow hooked up to the old wall unit under the window. There are no ventilation ducts in the entire room. Just this old noisy unit. Perhaps the hotel had not switched the air conditioning on yet - the weather was unseasonably warn and the room was HOT. Thermostat set to 65 did nothing to cool the room. The closet (which is a walk in) and bathroom were very uncomfortable. Bed was ok. No top sheet - which was weird. Towels were luxurious. No hot water in the morning. A call to guest services stated they were aware of the problem. (Previous posts also mentioned this - perhaps a recurring problem?) Maid service left no soap or shampoo despite the original bottles being used up. Towels were just set on the counter not hung up. The ambience of the hotel was just not for me. Seemed like a bunch of young people playing dress up, all trying to be something they are not. Felt like the hotel is trying to be the poor man's Ritz. I would not stay here again due to the arrogant aire everyone gave off. Also it is dog friendly and I try to stay away from places the allow dogs in the lobby - I just don't get that (and yes I have a dog). If you are here to enjoy the bars this is a good location. If you are into the shopping on Mag Mile there are far better locations. Price on Last MInute Travel was about $80 a night. It is worth no more than that.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place”
Reviews.Author: davey67
Reviews.Content: The whole experience at public was wonderful. The hotel is absolutely beautiful in it's simplicity. The staff is top notch , they are friendly ,approachable and the service was incredible. The bar was also great the servers were super friendly and after one visit they remembered our drinks every time we went in over the next four days. P.S. they also made the best side car I have had in a long time. Can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “White paint & brown paint sprayed all over the place now.”
Reviews.Author: mytravelcompanion
Reviews.Content: The place needed a renovation top to bottom and it has finally had it. Stayed there many times in the past five years for work and bring my my wife & family with me for some added days of pleasure on my own dime Honestly, when I went 2 weeks ago with my family, my 6 year old daughter said, dad i didn't know you could paint couches. Thought about it and you know what she was right. Each room i have been in since the new people took over is basically the old furniture spray painted white. The more you look around you see that every thing in the room is the old stuff, if you'd ever stayed her before, has been spray painted white ......crazy but that's what you experience. The bathrooms are still tiny, not renovated, just spray painted white except a new sink i think. Hallways are cool with brown painted walls, dark but looks beautiful. The famous Pump Room looks great now. Trendy small plates of food and drinks starting mostly at $19.00 each are lushish. NY city prices in Chicago. Kind of cool though, if you have money to burn and aren't too concerned about service. Skip staying here but spend a few extra bucks on a drink in the Pump Room to see what the famous old timers experienced. Didn't eat at the Pump Room in its glory days but the photos all over the place in the hotel will show you it's not like it was back then..... and it shouldn't be now it is 2012. I feel really bad about saying something bad about my home away from home when 5 days every 3-4 weeks. Rather like loving an abusive partner, you deal with it and know it is not supposed to be like this.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: djmatthews
Reviews.Content: We arrive via taxi from O'Hare Airport. Our welcome was very pleasant taxi doors opened by the door staff and our luggage promptly dealt with. Check-in was a breeze, and we were soon escorted to our room by a very friendly chap. We opted for a standard room which was very comfortable, cosy and well appointed. It had everything we needed. I would like to echo a few points that have been made on tripadvisor already. I can imagine some of the rooms will look very tired, very quickly. Beige carpets will not last. Some of the decoration does look a bit rushed, and again, overtime may start to look tired. The public areas are clearly designed for locals and non-residents. This is not the kind of hotel where you can relax with a quiet drink after a long day sightseeing or working. Every night the bar, restaurant and public areas were jumping. It clearly attracts a youngish and affluent crowed, however, this didn't bother us, but it may bother some guests. The hotels biggest asset are its staff, everyone we met was great, helpful and in no-way pretentious or snooty. If you like the latest, trendy, place to-be-seen hotel, then this is for you. If you want a more traditional business hotel or a quiet relaxing hotel, then perhaps look elsewhere. Location.... this is a matter of opinion. We liked it, a few minutes walk and we were at the top of the Magnificent Mile. Also, a short walk to the Subway and the Chicago Museum, restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Best, Coolest Hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: PacHeightsTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying 7 nights at the Public Chicago (formerly the Ambassador East). Ian Schraeger transformed this classic Chicago institution into a hip, cool, comfortable and beautiful hotel. The common areas were impeccably decorated and created a lovely, peaceful and visually stunning environment. I was in town for the Housewares Trade Show and got the amazing rate of $136/night for a standard room. I was on the 16th floor. The bed was perfect and furnishings were minimalist cool. Great bathroom and blissful quietness. Also, the neighborhood (Gold Coast) is a spectacular residential area with lovely condos and homes to check out. Still the heart of Mich Ave Shopping is just a quick 10 minute walk away. Finally, the Pump Room bar and restaurant in the hotel is fabulous. Very busy as lots of locals hang out there.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Modern Hotel - A Must Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jenniye5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Public Hotel this past weekend, it was amazing! We live in the CIty, but enjoy occasionally staying at a hotel here and there. I must say, this hotel definitely did NOT disappoint. It was a fabulous stay! Lobby - Front Desk Area - Beautiful. Very sleek, clean, modern decor. Service is excellent, valet parking ($45 in and out service), front desk help, everyone is very friendly and accommodating. We had a Standard King on the 7th floor, and it was beautiful. There are a total of 17 floors. The rooms are similar to the clean, sleek modern decor that is displayed throughout the hotel. Room wasn't very large, however it was comfortable, attractive, and lovely. Simple clean lines, great design, the bathroom, while on the smaller side, was also very clean. Loved the products given too! Complimentary Wi-Fi given, which is a plus, as some hotels charge $10/day for it! Location - right in the heart of Gold Coast, and a couple of blocks away from the Lake, shops, and restaurants. GREAT location, and being residents of the City, I can vouch that you will feel like a million bucks staying around this areal Parking and Transportation - couple blocks to the Clark buses, and the 151 Sheridan bus that takes you right onto Michigan Ave. If driving, valet parking is available for $45/night, with unlimited in and out service. There is a parking lot across from the hotel but does not allow you to go in and out, therefore my husband and I opted for the valet parking. Very quick and convenient. Just call about 10 minutes before you are to head out, and when you get to the lobby, your car will be ready! I highly recommend staying here if you're in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “A Trendy Tourist Escape”
Reviews.Author: MyHotelGuy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the hipster hideout, you'll definitely find it at Public Chicago. Walking in, you will feel like you are among the few people that have been told about this secret sophisticated sanctuary. I will say that that checking at a place like Public was almost like going through a screening process to get access to all areas of the "cool kids clubhouse". -Rooms- Not much to say except the rooms at Public left me with mixed feelings. When I first walked in, the first thing I said out loud was â€œOh, this is bland.â€� I had higher expectations after just experiencing the game-filled lobby. However, after â€œconnectingâ€� with the room, it started to grow on me. The rooms had a freshness that I found quiet calming considering all of the action in the â€œpublicâ€� areas. However, I would have liked to see a little more color. Overall, the rooms were comfortable and temperate, but not spectacular. -Food- I would describe the food at Public as pleasantly decent. I decided to skip the Pump Room restaurant and order room service, which offered the same menu items. I ordered the Public Burger, which was absolutely amazing. Usually I find myself spicing up a burger, but I was shocked that I didnâ€™t have to do that this time. I also decided to try out Public Express, which is Publicâ€™s gourmet fast food option. I ordered the slow roasted organic turkey sandwich, which tasted way better than it looked. Aesthetics aside, Public Express is a nifty option if you are on the way to the airport or wanted to stash some food as you explore Chicago. -Bottom Line- So, hereâ€™s the deal... I am not sure that Iâ€™d sleep here again (donâ€™t hold me to that). However, I would hang out at Public every chance I got. It is a perfect watering hole, lounge, and brunch spot, which is what itâ€™s known for. I am not sure why the name â€œPublicâ€� was chosen, but if it was to be open to the public then the mission was accomplished! There are so many different inviting â€œpublicâ€� areas from the coffeehouse-like library area to the sophisticated Pump Room. With rates starting around $140 a night, you might want to give this hotel a try. I paid $195 a night, which included a complementary upgrade and $25 food/beverage creditâ€¦not bad at all. Public is an inconspicuous little hotel tucked in a residential neighborhood 10 minutes from Michigan Ave. You are so close to the action, but off the beaten path enough that you could call yourself a localâ€¦at least for the time that you are a resident at Public. MyHotelGuy.com Twitter: @MyHotelGuy

Reviews.Title: “Unmatched service, absolutely stunning surroundings. Stay nowhere else in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: ljeter582
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at PUBLIC three times since it opened last fall and it gets better everytime. The location is perfect for shopping and restaurants without having to stay on Michigan Avenue. The interior is simply divine - from the common areas, the restaurant and, most of all, the overnight rooms. The absolute best part about the hotel is the staff!!! They are fabulous, are ALWAYS accommodating and have made each stay memorable and flawless. Thank you, PUBLIC! I will see you on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged!”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: Two days after my visit I saw a $118 charge on my credit card. I was charged for alcohol from the mini bar that I did not drink. The biggest complaint was that I paid the valet $60 cash for my car and I was charged for it again on my credit card. I found out the valet are not suppose to accept cash due to the automatic billing of the credit card. I ended up paying $105 for the valet parking my car one time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and AMAZING staff.”
Reviews.Author: pokers7
Reviews.Content: I would return to this hotel in an instant. Best staff experience I have ever had. Rooms were super sleek and Pump Room was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jsbremner
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience all round, from booking to check in, to room quality and service during my stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service was EXCELLENT!!”
Reviews.Author: Melhoffman1208
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and after reading a few reviews I was a little worried. However upon arrival I was happily surprised by the smiling faces awaiting us. The staff here is beyond helpful! I would love to stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Property for $1! :-D”
Reviews.Author: aaucello
Reviews.Content: Back in January, I lucked out and was able to book 2 consecutive nights at the Public Chicago during their $1 sale. The 270 $1 rooms sold out in minutes, and many have argued that the sale was a marketing hoax/publicity stunt on behalf of the hotel. The good news is, Iâ€™m living proof that it was a real deal, and frankly, my entire decision to take a trip to Chicago with my girlfriends was influenced by this sale. In fact, we were thrilled that we were able to make this trip possible for under $100 each including round trip airfare. Overall, we had a great 2-night stay for a grand total of $2.34 including all taxes. The chic boutique hotel is conveniently located in downtown Chicago, a few blocks from the famous Michigan Ave (The Magnificent Mile). A cab ride from ORD is about 20-25 minutes depending on traffic and will cost roughly $35; luckily there were three of us to split the cost. As you can see from the website, the Public Chicago is a new addition to Chicago, with its grand opening in October of 2011. The Public is a very sophisticated luxury hotel conceived by Ian Schrager (creator of Studio 54). Inside the Public is the Pump Room restaurant, bar, and lounge. We did not dine at the Pump Room during our stay, but we did have a drink during happy hour (5-7 pm). The crowd was a bit older (45 ish), and very upscale. As far as drink prices, they certainly were very expensive for Chicago. I ordered a mojito, and it was $15; letâ€™s just say that I was sure to sip that drink for a very long time. The staff were friendly and accommodating overall. Since we arrived to the hotel before check-in, they allowed us to leave our bags with them so we could explore Chicago for a bit. We had lunch nearby at Gibsonâ€™s on Rush Street, which was only about 3 blocks away from the property. During lunch, the front desk called us to inform us that our room was ready. The lobby, common areas, and rooms were absolutely stunning, modern, and artistic. We were certainly impressed, and most importantly, we enjoyed some much-needed quality â€œgirl timeâ€� away! If you missed out on the deal the first time around, donâ€™t fret. Theyâ€™ll be another chance of scoring a room of your own for $1. The Public Chicago will soon be announcing another round of 270 rooms available for $1. You must register your email address to be notified of the sale, and act quickly! The lobby of The Public Chicago was definitely chic, modern, and stunning. We were given a standard king room. I'm surprised all three of us were able to comfortably share this bed. Flat screen TV and decorative artwork I loved this modern desk and faux-fur throw. The mini bar and menu (caution: very steep prices). Fully stocked mini fridge. Again, very steep prices. In-room snacks and gift memorabilia. The Public candle costs $65. Ouch. The bathroom was stocked with The Public's own line of bath products (shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, and bar soap). The sink was modern and had plenty of hand towels. The shower was new, immaculately clean, and had the best water pressure I've ever experienced at a hotel. For my complete review inlcuding pictures, please visit: http://boardingarea.com/blogs/justanotherpointstraveler/2012/03/03/hotel-review-public-chicago-1-sale-success/

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Dustin T
Reviews.Content: We loved our short stay at The Public Chicago. The staff was eager to please, the location was quiet but still close enough to walk to any excitement you might desire. We had brunch at the Pump Room and it was excellent. They are kid and pet friendly and even have cartoons and food for the kids on weekend mornings. This is going to be our first choice for Downtown Chicago hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Chi-town”
Reviews.Author: gpilgrim
Reviews.Content: the place doesnt stop, from tues to sat the bar area is buzzing, must try the eggplant bread, awesome. Front desk staff and guest services very friendly and prompt, helped me getting reservations and blackhawk tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Public Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: vixen8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a 4* hotel in the loop, did some bidding, and received the wonderful Public Chicago. The location was perfect, a mere 4 min. walk to Gibson's Steakhouse, Starbucks, and maybe a 20 min. walk to Macy's. It is the cleanest hotel I've been in, and if you love people and socializing like we do, the crowds in the bar area are perfect. I felt like a part of city, even though it is only the 1st time I've stayed in downtown Chicago. We ate at the Pump Room our first night and rate it the best meal of our stay. (Salmon!-me and Pork Chop!-hubby) Sitting in the cozy fireplace room, sipping on a glass of wine, watching people come and go=perfect time!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: anne f
Reviews.Content: I reserved on Priceline yesterday, and won a night at Public Chicago for the weekend. Health issues prevented my stay. I called and spoke to Tayron in reservations. She handled my concern professionally. Tayron said she or Priceline would call me back soon, and within the hour I had heard from Priceline. Tayron paved the way for Priceline to return my money to me, all with courtesy. I look forward to staying at Public Chicago very soon, and I credit Tayron for my favorable impressions.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: kelleyse
Reviews.Content: The recent renovation looks great. Dining in the pump room was delicious. The bars were so popular in the evenings, glad I didn't NEED a drink. Bathroom lighting is a bit poor if you are trying to do much with makeup ladies. Huge 50 inch bedroom TV was terriffic. Staff all seemed extremely enthusiastic and entergetic. Furnishings are a bit Modern European and the bed was very restful. We would enjoy staying again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous design, superb food, and an engaged and service-oriented staff”
Reviews.Author: harrietlansing
Reviews.Content: We came out of a rainy February day into the elegant warmth of the Public lobby and its well-trained and personable staff. Our room was excellent; the magnificent design of these rooms make them bright, functional, restful, and can restore the human soul after long meetings, challenging weather, or just the normal slings and arrows of everyday life. The staff is very well trained and committed to a guest-oriented approach to everything. The food is sensational. From the home-made yogurt and granola for breakfast, through the slow-roasted salmon salad for lunch, to the exquisite dinner selections--including vegetables that can make you love brussels sprouts and broccoli--the quality of the food, the quality of the service and the overall presentation was flawless. Definitely one of my stellar hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Z
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the here after receiving many emails and snail mail publications advertising how fantastic the newly remodeled Public Hotel is; and the price was so reasonable we couldn't pass it up. We live in Chicago and were hoping to have a quiet night away from the kids. Upon arriving at the hotel it seemed pleasant, a bit hip on the style, but the crowd that was hanging out in the lobby was definitely carrying AARP cards. The rooms are very small and very stark. The heating system was extremely loud, but it came in handy when we were trying to go to sleep and needed to drown out the noise from the adult movies which seemed to be on continuous play all night long in the room next door. At 4 in the morning we were awoken by voices that sounded like they were in our room but they were coming from the adjoining room which we had a door to within our room and you could see light coming thru the room. We started talking ourselves and I think we shocked the new arrivals b/c they were a little quiter after that, but you definitely could hear everything thru the walls. I did call guest services to complain and they were helpful, but it was such a bad experience that by that time we were wishing we had just stayed at home. If you are looking for a quality hotel to relax in this is not your place. If you are looking for somewhere to stay so you can enjoy/party in Chicago's nightlife and don't care about luxury or noisy neighbors you would be fine to stay here. We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not guest friendly, especially for families”
Reviews.Author: Patrick S
Reviews.Content: It was bad from the start. We're a young family traveling traveling with a young one, and the entrance doors are not big enough for a stroller, not to mention a wheelchair. After waiting quite a few minutes for one of the two minuscule elevators, then getting on and not being able to find the floor buttons because the elevators were dimly lit with no backlight on the floor buttons (remember to pack your flashlights), we finally got to our room. Upon entering, it was nicely furnished, but we noticed it was quite small. The beds are 12 inches off the floor, and quite uncomfortable. The walls are paper thin, as we learned after the next room turned on Sportscenter at 1 am as we were trying to sleep. We were meeting family in town, and since there was no room or seating accommodations in the suites, we decided to meet downstairs in the lobby. After getting Starbucks and cupcakes, we were informed 10 minutes later that there was no eating or drinking in the lobby (what?!?). Meaning you can't find space in this place to hang out for a bit and enjoy coffee or a drink with friends and family. I don't get that philosophy, especially for a hotel. There are two restaurants in the hotel, but I must say the patrons were given more preferential treatment than the hotel guests, which is consistent with the other reviews I've read. But hey, there is free wireless, nice Mac desktops downstairs, and nicely decorated. But compared to the 15 or so other hotels we've stayed at in Chicago, ranks up there with the worst for us. Poor customer service, and they've ignored the basics before upgrading the amenities in the redesign. We won't be returning, and I would avoid if you have other options.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy veneer (barely) covers aging shell”
Reviews.Author: JRB1501
Reviews.Content: First the good: clean, contemporary, with lots of energy, both from the fashion forward clientele and the great coffee in the library/coffee bar. The staff is young, attentive, and readily available; and the Gold Coast backdrop is a great alternative to Michigan Avenue hotels. Now the bad: stay here only if you plan to go to bed very late, very tipsy, and don't need much sleep. Noise from the dimly lit halls carries and is incessant. The heating/cooling system, while seemingly under your control, blows whether you turn it on or off. And you will want to turn it off, because it creaks, groans, moans, and clicks unpredictably all night long. In short: a great choice to burn through some cash surrounded by fun-loving urbanites; a bad choice traveling with kids or expecting to refresh before an early morning business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at a very funky hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vicky2585
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel with staff who are super attentive and efficient! I will definitely stay there again as booking in advance it was competitively priced. Good rooms (bathroom a bit small but clean and functional) comfy beds and you get priority booking for the pump room...bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Really a 3.5, "Good" property”
Reviews.Author: ADSGWD
Reviews.Content: Since tripadvisor doesn't have a "good" category, I rounded up to 4. I found the hotel to be somewhere in between "average" and "very good". From the photos I had seen and from the write-ups I had read, I think I was expecting something a little more along the lines of a W or a Sofitel - very modern and style-focused with touches of luxury. This was not a gut renovation of an old hotel. There was no gutting, merely putting in new furniture. It almost felt like they didn't finish the job. For example, the wall outlets and light switches hadn't been replaced and were old and yellowed. The doors and door knobs were all original. I don't know if this was a stylistic choice, perhaps it was, but it didn't have the effect of "modern meets vintage". Instead, it came off more as a lazy job of updating. My husband and I stayed 3 nights in a one bedroom suite. The suite was large and comfortable; however, the bathroom was small. The suite came with two very large closets, one of which was right next to the bathroom. I told my husband that they should have knocked out the wall in between the bathroom and this second closet and made a lovely, spacious bathroom with separate tub and shower (ours only had tub/shower combination). There was also no storage or counter space in the bathroom. And, possibly most egregiously, our bathroom had no hot water on our first morning there. Inexcusable for any hotel, but particularly in Chicago in February. The staff took care of it and was very apologetic about it, but I don't think a hotel that is trying to position itself as "high quality that is affordable" should have this problem. It made me think that they didn't put new plumbing in the old building either. We did enjoy our stay because we like Chicago and it is in a nice neighborhood just north of downtown - close, yet quiet and more neighborhood-y. However, I do not think I would recommend it. We paid a special, discounted Jetsetter rate for our room so it was fine, but I wouldn't pay the full price for it. Lastly, the public areas of the hotel are fantastic, Library Bar and Pump Room. We had one experience with the Pump Room that left us slightly upset - we arrived at the hotel on Saturday night at around 7pm. We had just flown in from LA and were starving and pretty tired and we didn't have the energy to venture outside in the cold and darkness to find a restaurant. We knew beforehand that the Pump Room is an extremely popular, new Chicago restaurant; however, we thought that as hotel guests they might be able to squeeze us in. We mentioned it at check in and were told that the front desk and the restaurant are kept separate. So we talked to the host at the restaurant and he told us he would call us and we were the first on the list. We sat up in our room until 8:15 when we went down to inquire and ask them to tell us honestly if we would get seated because if not, we were going to go somewhere else. There was an empty table right there for us. He had neglected to call us. As a restaurant in a hotel, do not make your hotel guests feel like second class citizens. We know that the Pump Room is not a typical hotel restaurant as patronized by non-hotel guests as well; however, as a hotel, you will have guests arriving who do not know the area and do not know where to go to eat and for convenience sake just want to eat downstairs. Maybe keep aside a few tables for those last minute hotel guests. We did get seated and the food was incredible, one of the best meals we've had in a long time, but we didn't appreciate the feeling that we were second-class citizens. (We had the same issue a couple years ago at the Surf Lodge in Montauk and it really negatively affected our perception of our stay there). All in all, there was a lot of good but also a lot of bad and I suppose the good slightly outweighed the bad, but only slightly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but...”
Reviews.Author: TylerDub87
Reviews.Content: To start off, the location is amazing. Close to everything, without the hustle and bustle of Michigan Ave. When we arrived, the doormen where very polite. We had our 2 yearold with us, in a stroller. As others have mentioned, upon entering the hotel, one MUST use steps. Not many, but steps none the less. The doorman helped carry the stroller up the steps. Once we got our bags to our room, we were very disappointed in the size. The bed is almost to large for the room. In the room, I did not have enough space to take a full step without running into something. Our view was ok. Nothing spectacular. After traveling all day, we went down to the Pump Room for dinner. It was around 7pm. We had just traveled and we were wearing jeans and polos. Almost half of the tables that we could see where open. We were told they had reservation wait lists for many hours. I left thinking it was because we were underdressed. The doorman who helped with the stroller helped us find a place to eat. When we got back, it was different doormen. They were counting their tips and never even acknowledged us. As others have mentioned the walls are very thin. I could hear the TV and conversations of rooms around us. The mattress was harder than I prefer. After check out, we left our bags at the hotel. When we returned to pick them up, there was no greeting or assistance with the stroller from the doormen. We had to hail our cab as well. They were just standing around shooting the bull. I'm not sure if I would recommend this hotel. I guess I expected more from a 4-star hotel. My largest complaint is the size of the room. Way to small for me. It was probably the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Laurenkarl
Reviews.Content: I had a little trouble finding the hotel since I thought the entrance was on North State, but ultimately figured it out. Parking with valet is about $10 more than lot across the street but you have in/out privileges and its covered. Check in was very courteous although as previously noted there was no description given of the property (ie: restaurants, gym,etc). I was in Chicago for business and had been up for 14 hours already by the time arrived so I was tired and hungry and just wanted to try out the Pump Room and go to bed. They offer a Happy Hour from 5:00 -7:00 so the bar was packed but when I spoke to the host he was able to offer me a seat immediately at the communal chefs table (it seats 12-14 and there were 5 guys seating at the opposite end but it was still comfortable). Service was a little slow but I enjoyed the people watching and the food was worth the wait. My entree had just arrived when the host came over to say they were going to seat 9 ppl but they would be happy to seat me at my own table. I did not think that was necessary and actually enjoyed meeting some ppl in the group! Rooms are modern but well appointed. My only complaint is my room was directly next to the elevator and the bed was against that wall. I was really tired so the noise did not keep me awake but you could clearly hear it going up and down ( beware if your room ends in 01). Check out was easy and the valets were very helpful in providing directions. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Public Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: TravelFoolSam
Reviews.Content: Great experience - from the staff to the hotel to the restaurant to the coffee bar. We'll stay here forever when we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The Schrager crowd all grown up!”
Reviews.Author: dzonelb
Reviews.Content: The Schrager crowd (guests not staff) all grown up! happy to see a more cosmopolitan crowd and less dancing twenty-somethings in the lobby and hallways upstairs. Room service from The Pump Room by Jean-Georges is the best room service one can hope for from a hotel. All in all it was a pleasant experience, I enjoyed the residential location as well as the decor and the fact that there is a Jean-Georges outpost on site. Somewhere the tag line "At PUBLIC, service matters most." doesn't quite translate successfully. The staff, although attentive, is not quite there in terms of anticipating a guest's needs. A birthday cake was delivered right after check in without silverware or plates to eat it with. A quick call to the front desk did solved the problem in less than 10 minutes. I requested said cake in the afternoon the day before my arrival so the hotel was not able to accommodate my request. The concierge was at a loss as well. I had to suggest to her to see if there were any bakeries near by which could come thru. I was able to arrange for the cake from 35,000 feet in the air at 5:00 AM with Sarah's. I would think that a good concierge would have been able to manage it from less than 1/2 mile away. If the hotel were not to bill itself as a "new breed" focused on "service" then I would have given them all 5 stars, for location, ambiance and Jean-Georges' outpost. But when they are so focused on selling themselves as a service institution and then come short, I simply cannot be an 100% fan.

Reviews.Title: “Service was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: vinpin
Reviews.Content: I was there on business for 3 nights and the best part about the hotel was the service. The staff was very polite and accommodating. I had a couple of issues that they very quickly and graciously took care of. The hotel was just redesigned by Yabu Pushelberg and the public areas in the lobby and groud floor spaces were, as to be expected, spectacular. Very tasteful and welcoming. During the evenings on Friday and Saturday, these spaces were humming and obviously was the place to be seen. The rooms were quite nice, but you can tell, they decided to save some money in these areas. Although the overall design of the rooms were quietly elegant and very tastefully done,I'm sure the designers were aghast at having to reuse the existing beige wall switch and electrical outlet coverplates on their pristine white interiors. Those old style toggle switches were a glaring eye sore and I really hope that they will change them soon. Overall I thought the hotel was gorgeous and I really enjoyed my stay. Even if you don't get to dine in the Pump Room, you have to at least take a peak. You won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “If trendy is your thing then this is your hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: CatM76
Reviews.Content: If you want to "see and be seen" and you like trendy, minimalist European style, this is your place. If, however, you want to be able to relax over a cocktail in the late afternoon or evening after a long day of Chicago shopping,etc., forget it. I wasn't able to get anywhere near either bar on either night so had to have room service bring a Baileys & bottle of water to my room (for $34.00.) The library/coffee bar is a nice touch. Door service was less than desirable. I had to hail my own cabs while the 3 "bellmen" chatted under the heater. I don't mind change, and the Ambassador East definitely needed a change, but this is extreme and there is nothing cozy or warm about this place. I guess if you're 25 and just want to party, it's a great place. A piece of American history has been destroyed. (I am grateful they kept off the photos of the stars from the old Pump Room, even though they are now in the basement) One more thing, the beds are about 4 inches from the floor so if you are traveling with older adults, forget this hotel. Hallways are VERY dark.

Reviews.Title: “Public Hotel Chicago - Sublime Experience in the Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: consortium1
Reviews.Content: As a longtime fan of Ian Schrager's hotel properties, I was confident my stay at Public Hotel would be excellent. I was not disappointed. I arrived late at night, but the Pump Room Bar was thriving. The Le Labo candles burning throughout the lobby and common areas create an amazing olfactory experience. Checkin was quick and efficient, the staff extremely competent, friendly, and stylish. The room was beautifully appointed in every way and I was disappointed that my trip was for business and didn't afford me more time to spend in the room and exploring the amenities of the property (restaurant, bar, lounge, gym, etc). If you want a sublime experience in Chicago, both the hotel and its location nestled in the Gold Coast are perfect. I've stayed in numerous high-end boutique hotels around the city, usually with excellent experiences. But Public is my new favorite and will be my first recommendation to friends or colleagues spending time in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to re done Ambassador as PUBLIC”
Reviews.Author: sbuxbaum
Reviews.Content: I had stayed many many times at the Ambassador East and this was my first visit to the redone property. The remodel of the rooms was sorely needed and I believe that the new look of the rooms is very modern and comfortable. I am not a big fan of the dark hallways, but I didn't stay in the hallway. The lobby is very stark, but the library area is very comfortab le and inviting. The Pump Room has lost much of it's charm, but is certainly a popular spot with the neighborhood at this time. I am convinced that anyone staying at the PUBLIC would be very satisfied, and this is a terrific location for business or pleasure in the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “My Kinda Hotel ... !”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandAnne
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times (4 ?). Name has changed since the last but it is the spot we'd always pick first. There are better hotels I guess - but we like this one. We stopped here first many years ago on a trip from Oz. We had a Rt 66 tour starting. Since then we've picked it as our hotel of choice 3 more times. To give you an idea - last time we arrived it was a catastrophe happening. Water broken - and bathrooms unusable. We were told they were fixing but if we wanted they would transport us to another hotel. We said we'd chance it - much to the surprise and thankful reponse of the lady in charge. The water was fixed quickly and things got back to normal very quickly. They are an efficient bunch. We stopped in our normal room - not the swankiest in the hotel - but we like it. Front of the hotel - about 7 floors up. They have an awesome restaurant - where you can feel the atmosphere and almost see the ghosts of old crooners and mobsters of days gone by. Easy walking distance to the Mag Mile, fabulous restaurants, and even Navy Pier. A short block to the lake and an easy walk to the train stop if you want to go to a ball game. Or an early morning walk is lovely - just you and the squirrels. Almost every restaurant style you could want nearby.A wonderful bakery around the corner for brekkie too. When we think Chicago - we think this hotel ! Would love to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, would go back”
Reviews.Author: Jaime M
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical after I got a great deal through Priceline because it seemed like one of those overly trendy too cool for school type places. And while that may have been true to some extent the staff was nothing but courteous and helpful and everything was clean. I was a bit dissapointed there was no coffee in the room, but the coffee downstairs was some of the best coffee I've ever had. Very good. The free wi-fi is nice and I also tried out the gym which is pretty nice for a hotel, since most of them are usually dumpy. Good: the hotel is very modern, clean, has TONS of character, the staff is extremely helpful, great coffee, decent gym, free WiFi. Bad: Room size was just okay, low shower pressure, The Pump Room and coffee bar seemed a bit pricey, parking is expensive. However that may be more due to Chicago inflation than Public inflation.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousTraveler143
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now. The atmosphere is very modern and upscale. The lobby is very nice and the coffee bar is excellent. Before I go any further, Albin the bellman rocks and should get a raise and a promotion...and no, I'm not a friend or family member. Here are the downsides, none of which would keep me from returning. The hotel is a little off the beaten track, so plan on walking about five blocks to get to the prime shopping areas of Michigan avenue - of course that makes it a little quieter outside at night, I've stayed at the Park Hyatt and listened to ambulances go by all night long. Second, their is a peculiar smell in the hallways...has a little tired smell going, best I can describe. Finally, if you like super plush beds that you sink several inches into, the mattresses here are firm, very firm. I did sleep very well though. The room amenities were very nice, the bathroom a little small but it worked. If you want a comparison, I'd liken it to a Hyatt Place or Westin Element.

Reviews.Title: “Backs up style with service”
Reviews.Author: aforth
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it. The rooms are stylish (if a little small) and all the staff were really helpful and friendly. The lobby area and bar are full of beautiful furniture and beautiful people. One of the biggest draws is the excellent highspeed wireless internet. The business center also offers free printing; I cannot stress how important this is, and I think it is shameful how other hotels try to nickel and dime customers by charging extortionate rates for what in the 21st century should be basic services. Another bonus is the room service which provided me with some excellent meals for very reasonable prices (coffee, freshly-squeezed juice, french toast, bacon and fruit delivered to my door all for $10). Two things still need to be addressed. There is no coffee maker in the room; I know this can be ordered from downstairs but it is not the same as being able to make it oneself. Second, mentioned in another review, the heating is problematic. If one sets the thermostat at 72, the heater blasts heat until it is too hot, then blasts cold until it is too cold, then blasts heat again. I couldn't find anyway to turn the fan down low or maintain the room at a constant temperature. Otherwise I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “We're here now.”
Reviews.Author: designdestinations
Reviews.Content: Well, we're here at the public right now....staying for four nights. Have a room right across from the elevator. Very noisy. Waiting for morning coffee delivery.....at this point we've waited 40 minutes. My husband has to leave for his meeting with no coffee. So....if you want coffee, start early. Called about it and was told "we have a lot of orders.' Will explore the public spaces ands see what they are like but at this point I'm not impressed with the service.

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: yeti1975
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night to see a blackhawks game with some friends. we weren't in the hotel much but for the most part the hotel staff was very nice. we did try out the library bar in the morning during checkout and the coffee was good and on the strong side. the feeling of the hotel is upscale with a young vibe to it. the location is great as well. the room we had was a regular room andy thought it was on the small side but was nice. the bathroom worked well with the exception of the placement of the faucet on the sink. overall i would stay again but they do have a few kinks to work out. we did have a burned out bulb in the bathroom and also the ice container had no plastic bag for it. the ice machine on the top floor was not working as well so i had to use the one on the 8th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, young and boutique style”
Reviews.Author: dshabes
Reviews.Content: Will work out some kinks, definitely for younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Public Service”
Reviews.Author: BillC47191
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find. Especially for the price. The staff was friendly and professional. The room was very nice. The common areas were cool to say the least. I liked the big clock behind the check in counter. Great coffee too. I don't think you can find better value in Chicago. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “will return”
Reviews.Author: dsb913
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came in from the burbs to stay Sat night.We had a very good experience.I thought that the service from the front desk was outstanding.We had some plumbing problems with the room which I guess is to be expected from an old building.The look of the public spaces is great and has a very young vibe.The rooms are small and I would advise trying to upgrade depending on the cost.Location is great even on a winter day.It will be even better in the summer.Despite the minor problems the front desk made up for them and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with a few surprising inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: Tots11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous, in an amazing location with a beautiful and attentive staff. We enjoyed our stay and would come back again. That being said, I was surprised/disappointed by a few things: 1. There is no coffee maker in the rooms. I like drinking a coffee in bed in the morning (especially when on vacation). I forced to go to the bar downstairs (and get dressed to look presentable in the swanky lobby and wait in a long line). This was annoying/inconvenient for a morning coffee drinker like me. 2. There are no robes in the rooms. We stayed in the hotel over a chilly weekend â€“ I did not pack heavy sleepwear & was freezing walking around the bathroom & room in the morning (even when the heat was turned on). 3. Be cautious of using the candle in the room. Itâ€™s an outrageous $65!

Reviews.Title: “Great transformation”
Reviews.Author: workplay
Reviews.Content: This is a great transformation of what was a dated hotel (I had stayed a few years back when it was the Ambassador East) but keeping good parts of the old and adding new touches that give it a great modern feel. I loved having wine and appetizers in the library bar with a view to the lobby on a Saturday night and just watching the interesting people come and go and move about. That is what a great hotel experience is about and very much like Delano, which is a very good thing. The rooms were modern and comfortable and the staff very accommodating. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ambassador East as a Public space”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel five times since it re-opend as Public in the fall of 2011. It is located in a residential neighborhood that I find similiar to New York in its feel. The hotel provides a consistently nice experience. The rooms are spare and contemporary and the public spaces are attractive. The lobby is taken over by the bar crowd in the evening and is a magnet for those looking for a "scene", especially on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sanman249
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel only a short walk from the Mag Mile (Michigan Ave). The rooms are fabulous and have a very modern look ..... it's like a "white wonderland" (you will know what I mean once you check in). Excellent beds, stylish furniture, excellent bathroom. Just amazing overall. They have a very stylish lounge on the main floor. You will get to see many locals there on Fridays. The lounge transforms into an excellent coffee bar in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “A new hotel that needs many improvements”
Reviews.Author: JeTSeTTerC
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I was very pleased with what I saw. The hotel is in a great location and the lobby area is very stylish and clean. However, as soon as I came into contact with the staff, I was very displeased. I paid for my reservation in advance, but upon arrival I was told that I would need to provide a credit card for an additional hold for incidentals. I travel very frequently and from previous experience, when a reservation is paid in advanced whether through the hotel or a third party, the EXTRA fees to be paid are listed in the terms and conditions of the reservation. I had no knowledge of this hold, so I refused to provide a card for it. A manager was called to the front desk and she was very dismissive and rude and acted as if she wouldn't let me check in unless I provided a card. After telling her more than once that I was not prepared for this, she handed me my key without telling me what floor my room was on, nor where the elevator was and that someone would be coming up to my room to collect all snacks and drinks from the mini bar! How rude and unprofessional! I was also told that I would receive a complimentary upgrade as soon as I arrived, but after meeting with this manager and denying her my card, I guess she had a change of heart and I never received that upgrade. My room was very clean and comfy, but very cold. When I turned on the heat, the room became extremely hot too fast! There is no balance. Also there are no heating vents in the bathroom. I also noticed in the menu that there was a Happy Hour from 5pm-7pm, but I checked in on a Saturday and wanted to make sure that this applied to the weekend. The front desk staff could not answer my questions and told me that while I was out, they would leave me a voice mail letting me know. I never received that voice mail and was told that they forgot my room #, so they could not call AND it turns out that the hotel NEVER has any drink specials, even during the week, so this is false advertisement. The drinks in the pump room lacked ingredients stated on the menu because they "ran out" and I paid $14 for a tart martini. Overall, this hotel needs to train their staff on professionalism and to be more knowledgeable of the hotel, the "Happy Hour" that does not exist needs to be removed from the menu, the heating system in the rooms needs improvement and the bar should be re-stocked of all necessary items before they run out! The hotel is in a great location near many bars and restaurants as well as the famous Oak Street shopping, but for guest expecting superb service from a hotel that charges about $300 a night, many changes need to be made asap!

Reviews.Title: “A real deal but wouldn't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: w b
Reviews.Content: It is clear the PUBLIC Chicago's strongest attribute is the excellent customer service. We had nothing but a pleasurable experience with the staff. The common areas and Pump Room are just what you'd expect from a Schrager hotel - very hip and modern. I suppose all of this would make up for the lackluster guest rooms. They are minimalist to the point of being cheap. Speaking of cheap, we booked our room on Priceline for just $65. Bargain price for a Chicago hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Little bit of old, a little bit of new”
Reviews.Author: Keenefleet
Reviews.Content: Return to the Public, a/k/a Ambassador East after many years. The place still looks great upon entering. The decor is much more 'edgy'. The staff is very professional but with a hip vibe. Like so much in the hip and edgy world there is no shortage of self consciousness . Nonetheless, it makes a good impression.The room was fine. Looked like they were going for a vague retro, but it fell more on the dated side than was intended. Only had a drink in the Pump Room. Nice spot. But will never understand why a bartender thinks that someone who orders a gin martini straight up wants it chilled on ice so long that it is watered down. If I don't want to taste the gin, I'll order it on the rocks. Workout room average. Breakfast in the Library was very pleasant with great service. The corporate rate I had made this an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel with some but..”
Reviews.Author: SRZurich
Reviews.Content: We were staying @ Public for a weekend before Christmas for some shopping without our kids. The hotel is newly renovated, the lobby is really impressive and at the time was decorated with a huge Xmas tree. The bar and the lounge are really gorgeous, with comfy sofa, loungers in front of a cracking fireplace and cool bar area always full of cool people. The restaurant, Pump Room is stunning decorated, service is impeccable and food is light, simple and delicious. I would say the common areas are the reason why you should choose this hotel. We had great breakfast time every morning in the lounge eating yummy "pain au chocolat" and drinking super cappuccinos ( really Italian style!! Compliments to the guys at the bar, I only had better in Milano's cafe Cova) while reading magazine or simply enjoying looking at the fire and great evening with lounge music and drinks before going out for dinner. The hotel bar and lobby are a venue themselves you don't have even to go out and look for something else as they are packed with a beautiful crowd! The hotel is a really cool choice but.. The rooms are quite small, we booked a deluxe room and were quite disappointed for the size and the decor. Previous we stayed at the Trump Hotel and I must admit is difficult to bet concerning room size, quality of the furniture and atmosphere. The rooms at Public are sadly just old rooms with a "touch-up". They are all white, looking also modern with new bed linen, new flat screen TV, new side boards and desk, modern lamp, carpet on the floor is also new but... There are stunning old light-switch /socket that totally clash with the new interior, carpet looks like just temporally placed (seemed not glued with all the cables passing under and over) and of a very low quality, air conditioning/heating is extremely noisy and looks as old as was the Ambassador West (former name of Public Hotel) door, walls and wardrobe are just painted white over (under still the old Ambassador stuff) and bathroom is tiny and definitely very poor in style! No bathrobe, no slippers, no quality toiletry product. The sensation we had is that money of renovation were just lacking at the room level and things were arranged to be looking as best as possible with the minimum investment possible! Nothing to do with keeping the "old spirit" because those things have nothing to do with history are just poor details that may not appear to everybody but were definitely disturbing our general feeling about the hotel. Overall we would recommend Public Hotel for young couple, friends looking for a cool hang-out, good location (easy walking everywhere especially to the stylish Rush street and neighborhood) we would go back most probably for another weekend of shopping (with low budget on hotel despite the prices are not so low!) but we would not choose it as comfortable hotel for a family trip with our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, with cool amenities”
Reviews.Author: DJSteve4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for NYE, booked the standard queen room, upgraded to a larger king room, would recommend not staying in the queen rooms, they remind me of staying in a NYC hotel. They are super accommodating to hotel guests. The rooms are IKEA style modern, with excellent smelling bath products. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cows with hats?”
Reviews.Author: McWarg
Reviews.Content: Come on people! This is an Ian Schrager hotel and should be understood as such! We stayed at the Public mid-week in December just before Christmas. We booked a superior king room. Initially we were offered one across from the elevator on the 12 floor facing Goethe Street â€“ south â€“ with a good view. The room was quite nice and the bathroom not as small as others. However, we could hear the elevator door and bell noise, so we asked to be moved which was done without question. The new room was slightly smaller facing State Parkway on the 13th floor. No real view. Smaller bathroom. Ok. Those are the facts. Now for the review. I think others have described the place pretty well. I liked the rooms very much. They are serene and in keeping with Ian Schragerâ€™s style, filtered perhaps through his time at Marriott. He did preserve the footprint of the original rooms and so yes, the bathrooms seem small by todayâ€™s standards. Yes, white paint goes a long way when covering age, but many of the doors and moldings are original and still show their paint layers. The hallways are dark, also hiding age Iâ€™m sure, but all his hotels have dark hallways. We slept really, really well â€“ even on the platform bed everyone else complains about. However, being an Ian Schrager hotel, I should have been better prepared for the public spaces and what goes on there. When we arrived on a Monday afternoon at 3, the place was dead â€“ so dead that we could not get a cup of coffee without begging at the bar. However, that night, when we returned from dinner, the bars and Pump Room had turned into such a scene that we had NO desire to stop in the bar and have a drink. As guests of the hotel, we felt that our hotel â€“ that we were paying to stay in â€“ had been taken over by external forces unknown. They really should reserve a place for guests only, so that one feels the hotel cares, even values, the people who pay to stay there. As a consequence we had not desire to eat in the Pump Room. But like I said, this is an Ian Schrager hotel! As for service, well, it is young and green and spotty. When my father used to stay here after Canadian fishing trips, back when it was the Ambassador East, the cooks in the Pump Room would keep his catch in their freezers and my sister and I would be led down to pick out our fish. Something tells me this is no longer my fatherâ€™s Pump Room. Final note: the art is terrible (except for those hanging orbs in the Pump Room) â€“ fire the art consultant! Cows with hats? Really? How old do you think we are?

Reviews.Title: “Matters Public and Private”
Reviews.Author: xoxoxox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this stylish update to the former Ambassador Hotel over Thanksgiving weekend for one night - Saturday. The lobby is as impressive as a new iPad. Modern, brash, youthful, vibrant - everything you'd expect from Ian Schrager. We got a real buzz walking in, past the outdoor heating units with their tall flames trapped in glass cylinders that emitted a welcoming radiant heat on the rather raw day that we arrived. Then we entered the elevator. It opened on our floor and the hallways were gloomy and uninviting. Then we opened the door to our room. The very comfortable bed was very close to the floor. No great issue there. The room was clean and white. The first hint of an issue was the popcorn ceiling. This told us plenty. The old hotel that this was must have had cracked and unsightly ceilings and the quick and easy way to deal with that was to apply popcorn. Our hearts sank a little. Then we walked into the tiny bathroom. Only room for one, I'm afraid. No bathrobes or slippers, either. Body lotion was missing and we went down to the front desk to get that. A simple note in the bathroom telling us to call the front desk to ask for this would have been easy to do, I think. No other major issues. But this isn't a Hilton Garden Inn, either. And we had just come from staying at one of these in Indiana and that room was larger and the bathroom much more accommodating and for a LOT less. But this is Chi town, after all and the nabe was quite upscale. We just wanted to feel pampered, though, for what we were spending, and after the experience of that lobby, we felt a tad let down. Breakfast was not included. We went elsewhere for that. Hugo's Fish restaurant nearby is a must. Wonderful service there. Pleasant service at this hotel, too - but the overall experience was not good enough, alas, to warrant another star. Saturday night was rocking in the big room with the huge fireplace next to the lobby. We will try other places next time we visit the city and see how they stack up to this moderately pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our new Chicago home!”
Reviews.Author: stephr007
Reviews.Content: Having grown up in Chicago, I've been coming to this hotel (what was the tony Ambassador West) since I was in diapers. The Pump Room was a staple for my parents and grandparents for decades and I remember so many great birthdays at the hotel and loved when they'd bring the phone to our table for a special call I'd seemingly received. I have also stayed at the AW many times and while it was always a place steeped in history, the rooms where what you'd expect from an iconic Chicago hotel-classy, dated, but fine. As my mom lives in chicago, we come back to visit often and have stayed everywhere (Drake, W Lakeshore, Peninsula, Grand Hyatt, Intercontinental, Marriott, Westin, Indigo, Sax, Aventi, Elysian, Four Seasons) and while midwest hospitality is amazing at all of the above, we have finally found our home away from home in Chicago. Ian Schraeger surely put his touch on the AW but luckily it's not as dark and eclectic as his recentish redo of the Gramercy Park Hotel in NYC -it's light, modern, beautifully decorated and with incredible service to boot! If you are looking to stay in the middle of the shopping area and want to walk outside to shop big box retail, this is not the place- although oak street and michigan avenue are just a short walk. But this is the neighorhood I know and love and I'm thrilled that there is now a place for us to stay that we love that's also just two short blocks from mom! I was also excited to see the young, well-heeled crowd that was in teh lobby and the Pump Room on Friday night when we checked in - I just hope the door stays curated moving forward to ensure it stays that way. Thrilled beyond about Public and know you will be too if service, class, location and sleek, modern comforts are up your alley. KUDOS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Public Hotel Downtown Chicago - 1301 North State Parkway, Chicago, IL 60610”
Reviews.Author: Traveling00Man
Reviews.Content: Summary: I stayed at this hotel this past weekend with my wife and I must say It was a pleasant experience. I was a little hesitant to book this based on the reviews I read. I did a little research on my own and discovered a winter special on the Public website which was a great deal for the area. Will keep this hotel in mind when I come back to Chicago. Tips: 1. Review the Hotel Website for room promotions (special offers) and you will save money. I saved $40 on parking and got a room upgrade at no extra cost http://www.publichotels.com/chicago/home/ 2. Try the coffee and the coffee lounge its about $4.00 but worth the price 3. Take a walk around the hotel to scout the area for possible dinner or lunch spots 4. If your coming during the winter months make sure you have gloves a scarf and all your winter gear You will need itâ€¦â€¦ 5. Talk to the concierge to see if there are any events or shows you might like to catch while in town. We ended up going to the Christmas Story Musical Hotel: Art deco style, free wifi access, free use of mac computers for browsing web. Price: The price of the room was 155+ tax 178.00 the price included (parking $40 and a free upgrade to a larger king room) Location: 1301 North State Parkway, Chicago, IL 60610. There were plenty of restaurants to choose from and all within walking distance. I'll put that in another review. We were about a five minute taxi ride to the Chicago theater which cost $15.00 with tip for five people (not bad) Staff: courteous I must mention that Albin the door man was exceptionally helpful and Phil at the front desk was also helpful. All the staff were well mannered and courteous. I think its difficult to find any business with such a staff. kudos to the hiring manager(s) Room: I found everything to be comfortable the bed was a king with plenty of space This was also the case with the bathroom. This contradicts what I've read in other review of this hotel. But I must say that I was very satisfied with the room . Pump Room: This was a happening place at night. If your into the night life, you will have fun here Final Verdict: I would stay at this hotel again Good luck to everyone hope you found this helpfull..

Reviews.Title: “Sleep on the floor”
Reviews.Author: Timothy F
Reviews.Content: Went two weeks ago to this former 5 star hotel. They redid the Ambassador East(why the name change). The redo is with the modern touch. The bed has no box spring so you end up sleeping 12 inches off the floor. C'mon guys this was not a good idea. The pillows were the most uncomfortable I have ever had. The room was small but clean just don't like the modern flavor, call me old fashioned but I like to climb up into bed not down into bed. The Pump room was okay, they just didn't improve on what used to be a great hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Mostly liked PUBLIC Chicago, but...”
Reviews.Author: han1974
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed 2 nights. We had been quite interested in staying at PUBLIC Chicago ever since its opening and got a great deal on Expedia, so we took advantage of it. While we enjoyed our stay there, we were also a bit put off by certain aspects of our experience there. What we found to be the most impressive aspects of PUBLIC Chicago are: * the beautiful public (no pun intended) spaces - lobby, Pump Room, the Library & Coffee bar * GREAT service from staff - everyone was very friendly, helpful, and responsive * free WiFi throughout the hotel as well as 4 iMacs for guests' use in the lobby * very clean, modern, minimalist decor in rooms * some of the best towels I've ever used in any hotel Things we a little bothered or put off by were: * tiny bathrooms * no dresser in a Standard Queen room * location - the hotel is located in the beautiful/quiet Gold Coast, but it's not as convenient as many other major Chicago hotels. It's not near the El and it's a bit of a walk to Michigan Ave. Since it's also nowhere near any expressways, getting to/from the airports takes a bit longer and costs more $ via taxi. What we found odd about the hotel is the clientele. For a modern, trendy reincarnation of a classic hotel, we expected a younger, more trendy guest population. However, most of the guests we saw during our stay were geriatric Midwesterners. When we did encounter an expected trendy clientele at the hotel's restaurant/bar, the Pump Room, it was full of pretentious, wealthy, older middle-agers trying too hard to socialize w/ equally pretentious partiers half their age. It was just weird seeing such a dichotomy amongst the people coming in/out of a hotel that openly markets itself as a hip, trendy, style over substance establishment. Despite some of the issues described above, we have no regrets over staying at PUBLIC Chicago. Having said that, even though there are many things we liked about the hotel and our experience staying there, there are better options in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Stark bare room with no personality, big on service”
Reviews.Author: Bren K
Reviews.Content: The charm of this hotel is amazing. The restaurant, lobby, cozy library and funky screening room were great places to hang out in. The location is great. Only a 10 minute walk to the mag mile. We arrived on a friday night and the place was packed with tons of well dressed people. This is the place to go to party. When we got up to our room, we were surprised that we did not hear any party noises going on downstairs. Unfortunately, the room was not to our liking. This was a very minimalistic room. Although not uncomfortable, it was devoid of any personality at all. The white walls made me feel like I was in a hospital. When I am getting a hotel room, I am looking for class and charm and a warm cozy feeling. I got this in the lobby, but not in the room. The bed was the worst part. It felt like you were sleeping on the floor it was so low to the ground. It was a platform bed so, my husband did not get a good sleep as the bed was not to his liking.

Reviews.Title: “Bare Bones Room Redo”
Reviews.Author: eatdrinklaugh
Reviews.Content: We stay in Chicago a few times a year and heard a lot of buzz about this hotel so we gave it a two night try. Check in was fast and friendly and service was quite good throughout our stay. We asked for a quiet room and got one away from the elevators, however every time a neighbor open or closed a door we could hear them. The mattress was BAD, hard as a rock. I could get past it practically sitting on the floor if it were comfortable but it was terrible. The bathroom is the size of a small closet with bad lighting, no magnification mirror, terrible blow dryer, lousy water pressure and a tub/ shower combo in need of a serious update. At $400+/ night I expect more. Including the use of umbrellas. We opted not to purchase the umbrellas the front desk wanted to sell us and took a cab to a store to buy decent ones. We thought the common spaces were fine and enjoyed the Pump Room. I did enjoy the "express" room service for breakfast both mornings. $5 plus 18% service charge got me a to go bag with a cup of coffee, orange juice, banana and two doughnuts in less than 10 minutes. There are a lot of great hotels in the Gold Coast area, this one is just OK.

Reviews.Title: “A very hip hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KateJones
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights recently and loved it! Beautiful refurb of old Ambassador hotel. Or room was by (a deluxe) with ok size bathroom. It is 'affordable' so lacked a few luxuries - shower cap, bathrobes, proper hairdryer, umbrellas... But we didn't mind so much. Breakfast in the Pumphouse was good and there's also a pastry/ coffee bar just off the lobby. It was absolutely mobbed on Fri and Sat night and v loud in the bar, restaurant and lobby - but we weren't disturbed by this up on the 12th floor ( room had great views too!). We've stayed at Sofitel Warer Tower before which is more expensive but not as nice! We'll be back at The Public again.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood location”
Reviews.Author: Lucy60785
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PUBLIC in November to attend the Festival of Lights. The hotel is in a fabulous location - blocks from Michigan Ave. The entrance is on a quaint side street which made for easy access. The hotel is also blocks from a neighborhood of local restaurants and shops. The hotel staff was friendly and prompt. We ate dinner at a "communal table" in the Pump Room and enjoyed the experience. We had a corner room which was a very nice size with nice light.. The common areas were very sleek and inviting - but very busy. We envisioned chatting by the fire in the Library Bar, but it was very busy both times we stopped by - more "bar" than "library". One other FYI - it was $45 a night to park your car. Overall a fabulous experience and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but lacks substance and service”
Reviews.Author: heathweb78
Reviews.Content: The common areas are very sleek and good looking. The Library Bar is a great space. But this is not a hotel that is luxurious or offers great customer service. We stayed in a Superior King room and it was pretty good except the bathroom still had an old bathtub and was small. They have clearly skimped on the upgrade of the rooms -- bed was pretty stiff, you could see the old paint job, and there is zero art on the walls. In terms of service, the front desk doesn't allow guests to borrow umbrellas (in a town where it rains for like 5 months nonstop), it took them 20 minutes to check us out and fix a charge on our invoice (and it wasn't fixed so now I have to call them when I get home), and no one was particularly welcoming our 3 day stay there. Plus the Pump Room was unable to move our dinner reservation from 2 to 4 people, which is silly and tells me they don't value guests staying at the hotel. There were two things I liked about the hotel: the fitness room had many, new machines and was decent sized, and the people who came to get dinner and drinks at night were all well dressed. It was a good scene if you stayed in the Library Bar and didn't hang out in the other bar near the Pump Room. Overall, I'd say this hotel is just a 3 star hotel that caters to one time guests and locals who will take friends and business clients there for drinks and dinner. Nothing really wrong with that but potential travelers should book knowing this.

Reviews.Title: “Very good but they are still working out the kinks.”
Reviews.Author: CocoFranco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for a few days and conducted all of my meetings at the hotel and the Pump Room so I am very familiar with it. Decor is very stylish but the rooms are uninhabitable unless you get a large deluxe king. I had to upgrade and could not stand the small size of the standard room so don't let the low prices fool you, you get what you pay for. The business center is a joke; 2 computers and 1 printer with an average wait time of 30 minutes. The food at the Pump Room was fine, not memorable and the service was trying hard to the point of awkward. Given the lack of cool, stylish hotels in Chicago, this is the only game in town right now. I will come back and hope that they have worked out their opening issues. Also, I tried ordering a latte in the morning and was told they would not deliver lattes to the room but that lattes were only sold in the "library" after 6:30am. Annoying when you have a 6am flight.

Reviews.Title: “Cheated on Starwood but it Was Worth it”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in nearly every Starwood hotel in Chicago and don't get me wrong, I'll always be loyal to them, but I recently stayed at the public as part of a company meeting and was pleasantly surprised. It actually has a feel of a W, but less stuffy, or maybe that's just Chicago. From the second the door of your cab is opened, the staff are great, directing you to checkin and the woman there was really nice and quick. The room itself is really modern, super low bed, desk and massive closet. The bathroom is a bit on the small side and the sink area a bit oddly designed so difficult to spread out your toilettries, but overall it the room was really comfortable and I liked the design. So my one complaint, yes, I literally think I found just one thing I would recommend for them to change - get body lotion in the bathroom! All 3-star+ hotels have this now and when I called down to get some, they checked and offered to run out and get me some, but that wasn't necessary. A hotel of this calibre should have body lotion in the room. Perhaps they had run out or hadn't gotten it in yet, I know this is a new hotel, but that was the thing I noticed. As far as our meeting went, I had 2 days in the conference rooms and everything was great. There were plenty of healthy options at breakfast - yogurt and berries, my standard breakfast, and everything was really fresh. There were more choices on other days too and really fresh orange juice. We didn't have any technical problems and everything was set up nicely. We did turn on the heat at one point and it smelled weird, but I guess it was probably the first time of the season that the heat had been used so that's normal. The lunch we had was really good, although the dessert portions, 3 huge donuts each, were a bit much :) I'm not too familiar with this part of Chicago, but we were able to walk to restaurants, even though when you're driving up to the hotel, it appears that it's at the edge of a neighborhood. Overall, I would highly recommend this place. I'm impressed they were so buttoned up, especially service-wise, for being so new.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cee C
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at PUBLIC Chicago for a weekend. The hotel is beautifully appointed and in a nice location, in the Gold Coast/Near North side neighborhood. It is quieter than the main tourist/downtown area though still within walking distance. Above all, kudos to the incredible staff that brought the experience from nice to outstanding. From pulling up to valet to accommodating check-in/check-out times, every experience was a pleasure. Hats off to the concierge who took their time to acquaint us with Chicago to make our experience outside the hotel just as enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grannyofthree
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for a birthday surprise celebration. We are a big fan of the Aloft hotel and found this to be similar in sleek design. Everyone from the valet parking, check-in, bar servers were exceptionally kind. You can still tell this is an OLD hotel but has been renovated beautifully. Neighborhood location is very quaint. Rooms are decorated in contemporary style, although the bathroom was pretty small. Would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mikefernow
Reviews.Content: you'll see from reading the reviews that this hotel possibly isn't for everyone.... it is sleek and contemporary - not only in design, but mindset.
