I travel to Chicago a few times a year on business - always stay downtown (in the loop).... this was my first time to stay slightly north of DT. The proprerty is located in the Gold Coast area - if it is a nice day, it is easily walkable to downtown (my meetings were downtown - I walked it in about 15 minutes). The best part of the visit for me was the proximity to Lincoln Park and other areas that made me feel like I wasn't even on business. I don't know Chicago well, but loved the area. If you know DC, it is similar to Georgetown or Dupont Circle; similar to the upper west side in Manhattan. There is an L station a few blocks away from the hotel, so you don't need to take a cab unless that is your preference. The decor is sleek - the rooms have a platform bed and simple but functional modern furniture. The service is great.... as an example, the mattress was too firm for me - they put a pad on the bed after a simple request. The staff gave great restaurant recommendations, and was quick to recommend best routes for walking. Although the hotel has a 'swanky' feel, the staff isn't stuffy or snooty. I booked on hotels.com and got a great rate even though there was a large convention in town. The location of the Public gives the advantages of being in the city without many of the disadvantages of being in the city. Would definitely stay there again if the rate was good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service at Public”
Reviews.Author: CanadianinNewYork03
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at Public where most of the experience was genuinely rave-worthy. What really stood out was the relaxed, anti-corporate style of the staff, all young but genuinely pleasant, helpful, proactive and professional. They seem to love their jobs. If there was a minor issue with the room or any part of our stay, they went above and beyond to provide an immediate, timely solution with no attitude whatsoever--love that! There's no being put on hold or transferred around, someone answers the phone from outside or inside the hotel and is immediately ready and willing to assist. Todd, the "Chef Concierge" was most helpful and really seemed to know a lot about the history of the hotel and many local attractions. A few of the Guest Services staff I met were truly outstanding; especially Katie and Alexa--both were extremely helpful prior to our arrival and proactively attentive during our stay. Can't say enough about the willingness of practically every staff member we encountered to deliver the best possible experience. We were very happy with the location; this beautifully renovated, classic old hotel is surrounded by wide residential streets, mature trees and charming residential buildings and brownstones. It's a short walk to several good restaurants like Hugo's Frog Bar and about a 20 minute walk to The Loop / Michigan Avenue. [We found it easiest to take a cab from the hotel to the nearest blue line and take the train directly to/from the airport, otherwise you have to switch lines and walk several blocks.] The hotel common areas are stylish and stunning--high ceilings, cozy seating areas and all the original architectural details dressed up in neutral tones and quirky accents. The Library room with a roaring fireplace off the lobby has wonderful coffees, salads and deserts to eat-in or to go. We loved the concept of express room service; a set menu where the wait-time was minimal minutes. There's no spa in the hotel but the concierge or guest services can order a masseuse to come to your room--in addition there was an Exhale spa a few blocks from the hotel. Our room was the best part of our stay...we booked a Loft and were graciously upgraded to a one-bedroom suite which was like having a chic, comfortable and relaxed apartment of our own. The rooms were beautifully appointed with every amenity and thoughtful detail, including a king-sized bed that was amazingly comfortable--Frette linens and huge down pillows. The only downside of our stay was some late-night street noise--a result of the vibrant scene that flocks in and out of the lobby Thursday - Saturday nights. The Pump Room restaurant, bar and lobby areas seem to pull huge crowds. We ate several meals in The Pump Room - every breakfast and a memorable dinner that was one of the best we enjoyed during our stay. Again, the food was great but the service really distinguishes itself and elevated the entire experience. Highly recommend it if you can get a reservation. Other amenities worth mentioning; free wifi and free access to the business centre and computers in the lobby. A nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great”
Reviews.Author: Joni-Herkimer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and chic but in a welcoming and warm way. The young, well trained and well dressed staff could not have been more helpful and welcoming. The hotel keeps some bikes that for guests and it was a treat to ride them on the nearby Lake Shore bike path. The location is perfect - easy walking distance to shopping and great restaurants but in a relatively quiet section of town. One downside is that the walls are very thin and you can really hear what is going on in the adjacent rooms. Fortunately, our neighbors were not partying. My guess is that if it became a problem, the staff would address it promptly. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled customer service”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel - bright, clean rooms, amazing location, great food, and above all, unparalleled customer service! My purse containing my cash, credit cards, license, and interview folder was stolen on the train, and they found a way for me to confirm my room reservation and order food. THEN, they called me to ask if there was anything that they could replace for me to make me feel more comfortable for my interview the following day, whether I needed make up, resume paper, or whatever. I just asked for a simple notebook and band-aids (I had hurt my hand trying to get my purse back), but they brought me a professional resume folder with pens and everything! I had been planning to wake up early and go buy a resume folder because never in my wildest dreams did I imagine that they would provide me with one. This is the greatest, most accommodating hotel ever. The valets and the front desk people are all excellent, and like I said, I have never had such an exceptional experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for hipsters: business travelers, not so much.”
Reviews.Author: wmchristopher
Reviews.Content: If you like W Hotels and minimalist design, this place for you. For my tastes there is too much emphasis on form and not enough on function and comfort. Definitely not a room to relax in or do some late night work. For reasons I don't understand the bed practically sits on the floor. Lobby is busy and loud with people seeing and being seen.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Mazk
Reviews.Content: I'm a soccer mom from the suburbs and I have to say that I found the chicness of this hotel a little intimidating. The crowd on Friday and Saturday nights was very young and well dressed...I felt a little frumpy. However, I was treated very well. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The rooms were small but had everything I needed. My only complaint is that the rooms were not soundproof. I could here my neighbors loud and clear. It's a great hotel...give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but toilets are too Public”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_from_IS
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, minimalist and chic. Hotel staff was very young but all were helpful and competent. Rooms have lovely sheets, down pillows and duvets, flat screen HD tv's and excellent free wifi throughout (a must). However, I do have a couple of issues: 1) Some of the remodeling work is shoddy - molding that doesn't go all the way where its supposed to and the remaining spacing filled in with caulk. 2) The bathroom has toilets akin to something you'd find in a public restroom (no pun intended) not a private hotel room. This is my big issue with the place in addition to the toiletries which are chintzy - just shampoo, conditioner, and soap. No bath gel or lotion. 3) Also, no kettle or coffee maker which is annoying as I doubt I'm the first person who wants to lounge in their room with a cuppa. Waiting for room service to deliver overpriced, cold tea/coffee doesn't start my morning the right way. I would have had a drink in the hotel but it was jammed with people on the make. Regardless, it's a good hotel in a great location and with value for style this place has it in spades.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding overall experience”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the newly renovated Public Chicago was outstanding. I was hesitant to book with a hotel that opened within the last month with new staff and still working out operational kinks. From the moment the bellman unloaded the luggage from the taxi, too the personal greeting from the front desk attendant, it was very evident the staff had been expertly trained and already functioning as if they were open for years. After seeing my initial room which was beautiful and well designed, I inquired if a larger room was available for my 3 night stay and my request was handled within minutes and a bellman was there to happily move our things to the new space which was exactly what I was looking for. During our stay we used every food service offered by the hotel, from the bar to the restaurant to room service for breakfast lunch and dinner on various days; in every situation our expectations were exceeded. The food and beverage quality as well as the service were top notch and most surprisingly fairly priced. The hotel had the new hotel buzz and was full of beautiful people, both employees and guest. Our only regret was that we did not get to spend more time in our room and in the hotel. I have stayed at every 5 star hotel in Chicago and although the other hotels have much more visible staff standing around to open doors and greet guest, Public Chicago's service far exceeded that of every other hotel in the City. I know some of the luxury hotel chains pride themselves on "anticipating" guest needs, every need cannot be anticipated. For those needs or special request which always come up no matter how nice the hotel as they did at Public Chicago, the staff at Public fulfilled every request quicker, more efficiently and with happier staff than any service from any hotel I have experienced. The commend the owners and management from doing such a tremendous job with the Public Chicago, you have created a truly sheik environment that allows everyone enjoy it at a fair price with outstanding service, congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Miss the old Pump Room, but...”
Reviews.Author: scribblewit
Reviews.Content: ... the new Public was well beyond our expectations. The re-do of the old Ambassador East was overdue, but we feared Ian Schrager's take would be uber-minimalist and not too friendly. Wrong. The new lobby is chic, warm and calm, neutral colors and luxe finishes. The fireplace still welcomes on a cold day. Rooms very white (what's with the 4"x6" photos?), but very comfortable. Can't say enough about the young, energetic and very friendly staff. Every need taken care of, quickly. Quick, reasonable room service. We did lament the death of the old Pump Room bar, one of Chicago's great institutions, and the wonderful iconic photos of the great and famous (a remnant remains down near the restrooms). New Pump Room bar looks like any hip upscale cocktail lounge. Didn't try the restaurant. Only glitch, and we suspect it will resolve itself once the new has worn off a bit, was the noisy herd of 20-30-somethings that jammed the place Friday and Saturday nights -- like coming home to Studio 54 in its prime. We headed over to the Drake for a quiet late-night drink instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby Design...”
Reviews.Author: Brent S
Reviews.Content: But I doubt I'd stay here again. It's just too much of a scene. When entering the lobby at night it's wall to wall wannabes sloshing their drinks all over the floors and furniture. After elbowing your way to the elevators you head to your room in solitude. Perhaps I'm too old for the hipness and bouncers at every turn. If it was really chic, a select few would know about it. However, Public has unleashed their PR machine to the hotels detriment.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your Pumps on and Keep Walking”
Reviews.Author: Jro_11
Reviews.Content: What at total let down. This is an iconic Chicago location. The service is beyond horrible. The staff is rude (including the management staff â€“ Jay is a joke), the food is average (at best) and the portions are small. Chicago is full of great restaurants. This is one I would skip. For three of us, we have a $1,000 bar bill and our service was a disgrace. Ian schrager, you should be ashamed of yourself. If the hotel is anything like the bar and restaurant, do yourself a favor and skip this place altogether. Trust me, read the reviews, service, service serviceâ€¦bad, bad, bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “I don't want to go home!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferG2011
Reviews.Content: I canâ€™t say enough great things about my experience at the Public Hotel. Not only will I stay here on my future trips to Chicago, the hotel alone makes me want to come back as soon as possible! Here are just a few of the reasons why I love this place: 1. Every single staff person throughout the hotel was friendly, warm, and welcoming. (They must hire them all from a modeling agency because they are unbelievably good-looking too!) 2. The public spaces are not only interesting looking and luxurious but also comfortable! If I have to spend 3 hours working at my hotel, why not do so sitting in a cozy sheep skin-covered chair, next to a fireplace with a delicious coffee drink! 3. Speaking of drinks, the cocktail menu is interesting and delicious as is the food menu. I havenâ€™t eaten so well sinceâ€¦ I canâ€™t remember when! And yet the prices are affordable! 4. The social scene here is very cool. People of all races, ages, and styles make for great people watching but the mid-western charm of the clientele made me forget I was rubbing elbows with the chic and glamorous. 5. Free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel is just an acknowledgment that we are living in a technology world and should do so without limitations. Charging for internet is like charging for air. 6. Free access to the nicest gym I have ever been to: totally unique design, more pretty people, AMAZING classes, (Iâ€™m still sore!), and top-quality gym equipment. 7. Perfect location â€“ walking distance to restaurants, shops along the miracle mile, and just steps away from the shore, (you canâ€™t beat that view!) I could go on but I shouldnâ€™t need to. Book your room now! You wonâ€™t regret it.

Reviews.Title: “It really doesn't get any better!”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and stay at the Public Hotel. From the moment we arrived we were in awe of the hospitality and attention to detail. Not only will you receive world class service but you will be amazed by your surroundings. Quirky, sophisticated, elegant, amazing! We chose the Public for our anniversary trip to Chicago. It was our first visit to the windy city and honestly we are thinking of moving to the very neighborhood that the Public Hotel is located in. Quiet, sophisticated and so close to the heart of downtown. It was almost like a dream. What a truly amazing job they have done renovating the historic Ambassador East hotel into a modern , eclectic gem! Our dinner at the Pump Room was the highlight of our trip. You made our dreams come true. If you don't choose the Public for your next trip to Chicago , you have missed out!!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal...but be sure to reserve a taxi”
Reviews.Author: jd294
Reviews.Content: This hotel's claim to excellent service holds true. A gentleman grabbed my bag from the taxi, and by the time I had paid the driver and made it inside, they had already pulled up my reservation and greeted me by name. My suite was comfortable, clean and modern and every staff person I encountered was exceedingly friendly and accommodating. For example, my server in the Library happily checked in with the Pump Room to secure a table for me for dinner, and the hostess called me to tell me when it was available. The real fun of this place, however, is the design. The 20-foot custom leather chesterfield coupled with a fireplace and sheepskin covered chairs made the bar a hard place to leave. My one sore point is transportation. Despite reserving the house car for my downtown commute in the morning, it arrived 30 minutes late. And no taxis were available as a plan B. Other guests were waiting 45+ minutes for a cab. The staff blamed the light rain and residential location for the problem, but one of those is a constant. Perhaps it was an off-day, but I would advise planning ahead to ensure you can get where you need to be on time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CharlieC33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Public this past Friday night. The service is outstanding. It started when we pulled up front. The guys working the parking were happy and more than willing to assist. Check in was a breeze and the staff were very professional and nice. We were than escorted to our modern hotel room and the bellman gave us a quick tour. When we returned after dinner the pump room was fill and things were happening however once on the elevator and up to our floor the noise was left behind. The hotel is also located within some of the best restaurants in Chicago. We had a great breakfast in the morning and the staff was there to serve you in anyway possible. Great experience at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Public Love”
Reviews.Author: naince
Reviews.Content: The Room (King Loft), the Library,the Coffee Bar, the Books, the Games, the Public Express Room Service, the Pump Room, the Pump Room photos, the Bicycles, the Neighborhood and most of all the friendly, helpful and happy STAFF! All earned our love from hello. Will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Christina D
Reviews.Content: Staying at Public Chicago is really an experience that I would highly recommend to others. The design aesthetic is chic and elegantly simple. Beautifully detailed and not overly designed. There are all the modern touches, but somehow it still has retained a sense of warmth that makes you truly feel welcome and at home (in a good way). The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and professional and they really made you feel like they were happy you were there. There are so many cool hotels, that have staff that make you feel like you are an unwelcome guest at their party, this was definitely not the case at Public. The common areas perhaps add to this welcoming feeling, the lobby, the library and restaurant were all very open and flowed into each other really nicely. I didn't eat there, but the design in the Pump Room was pretty awesome. While on the subject of food though, I loooooved the express room service concept, affordable and fast and the french toast was evil it was so good. Neighborhood was beautiful, overall a really great way to spend some time in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOTEL AND STAFF”
Reviews.Author: tanzynighter
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I travel alot and I can be very critical at todays prices I want things done right and this hotel delivered in every way !! I loved the staff they were so friendly and chic in there black hightop sneakers and very helpful with ideas for things to do to getting me my favorite dessert not on the menu "thanks Katie" great pudding !! The room was so fresh and zen like I felt very relaxed and the bath towels were so fluffy very nice! The room was large with a big bathroom and so quiet and for the first time ever i did not see one cleaning cart ...The location cant be beat it felt so safe and the beach across the street was a bonus just breathtaking ..The food was so good we ate all meals in the hotel we couldnt get enough of this amazing menu and low prices ..I dont know how they do it but dont stop !!! We will be back asap !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Precision, Style, Casual Chic, Service & Best Effort to Please”
Reviews.Author: karenbertoli
Reviews.Content: Dear Fellow Travellers- Business/ Leisure: I will preface this recommendation by stating I am a frequent international traveller, live in London part time, Executive Platinum American Airlines, VIP Open Table, etc. - needless to note, I am constantly setting up camp at hotels, airports, restaurants worldwide. Notable: I also have HIGH expectations for the BEST service, products, options, connectivity, quite room atmosphere, world class fitness equipment, cleanliness and STYLE -this is how I roll. Period -to please me is no easy feat â€“ I AM MORE THAN PLEASED WITH MY STAY AT THE PUBLIC HOTEL, the newly refurbished former Ambassador East in Chicago's elegant Gold Coast. Below you will find exactly what I find to be appealing, attractive and addicting enough that I extended my trip twice whilst residing, have entertained important business customers 4 times at The Pump Room - new food and wine list and priced very well -see below: â€¢ Precision: Every single staff member went through a 3 week training process and it shows (I got to know them in the Library bar and restaurant.) The staff is HAPPY so guess what? Happy people deliver HAPPY precise service- â€¢ Style: The hotel kept the original architecture and integrated incredible style, casual chic with the most beautiful working fire place, open rooms, the highest ceilings, love seats and a scrabble (my fav,) always on hand. â€¢ Casual Chic: I am American so to see all staff wearing the latest skinny jeans from Levis, Chuck Tailors and high heels and tasteful fitted black little numbers for the cocktail ladies, I am thrilled and my customers, most financial, are, its perfect. I am able to hang out in a Cavalli number or flip flops and it all fits . .advising all to shower up - the crowd around here is easy on the eyes - :) â€¢ Service: This is a BRAND new hotel with BRAND bar, restaurant, service rules and staff. A few times there were silly mishaps but were fixed so quickly and SOLVED without drama, I have never experienced such great attitude service, probably because these people are happy to serve, they are cool with it and so am I. â€¢ Best Effort: With a new establishment, not everything goes according to plan, flexibility, customisable things, and trying a bit harder to impress the first time are all key initiatives. I do think BEST EFFORT is directly related to leadership and guidance and also, is directly correlated with HAPPY people - it is not PUSH or aggressive, but mellow and effective. These people cannot do enough to make everything work to your liking â€“ Finally, I am thrilled to have discovered this place in my most coveted old neighbourhood, I even checked out an apartment to buy across the street. I have decided not to buy the apartment and just stay here when I am in town. A pleasure, Karen Bertoli karen.bertoli@fixnetix.com

Reviews.Title: “Public Chicago a must!”
Reviews.Author: Dora M
Reviews.Content: One of the best experiences in my life, and I travel a lot! Right from the start: located in the best Chicago residential area - the quiet, aristocratic Gold Coast,- you arrive at this elegant, welcoming entrance. The staff is sweet and helpful (and they remember your name for days!) then you walk into this cloud-like place, like a hip temple for every day and for everyone, with communal tables and computers for all. The lobby, the library (where you read, talk and drink delicious coffee or libations at night) and the rooms are exquisite! You must order breakfast: a new way of getting your morning fix is in place: you're in for a surprise, that arrives fast too! Then, there is the celebrated Pump Room, where Jean-Georges does his magic, affordable for all size pockets. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: caryfcindyr
Reviews.Content: As Chicago residents, my wife and I decided to stay downtown this weekend and picked the new hotel on the grounds of the former Ambassador East. I have never reviewed for trip adviser, but had to relay the story of this great place. First, the location. It is a one block walk from Lake Michigan beaches and Astor Street neighborhood represents a walk around one of the most beautiful residential streets in the world. Gorgeous old mansions-prettiest street in Chicago. The restaurant is a spectacular recreation of the famous Pump Room. Pictures of Cary Grant, Don Rickles, etc. are remembrances of the past, but the modern decor of the restaurant is a knock out. Two rooms of bars, library, and couches surround the restaurant and at night were filled with crowds of people from 25-70 years of age, straight and gay, white and black, all mixing to music and discussing everything under the sun. We spent half an hour just sitting on a couch and people watching as men mostly in blue jeans, mixed with well every sort of friendly individual you can imagine. The food in the dining room for dinner and breakfast(everything made fresh in the kitchen) was great and meals were about a very reasonable $20 or so. My wife's pasta was the best she ever had and my pork chop was terrific. The atmosphere was simply electric. We were on our way to a $100 a person restaurant when we decided to eat here as it was as fun as can be mixing with loads of couples before dinner. The rooms were decorated with fun and leisure as goals, and our upgraded room was huge.. Every person working in the hotel went out of their way to make our trip terrific. The location is a short cab ride from downtown and Michigan Avenue shopping. We love Chicago and have lived here all our lives. We would recommend staying here to anyone-from out of town or for a romantic weekend away from home. If you fly into Midway or O'hare you can cab around the city for a weekend without a car. Great for singles or couples. Seemed to attract many locals to the location. Makes me proud of our city and certainly the friendliest atmosphere possible and This is an independent for real review. We have stayed at all of the $500 a night Chicago hotels and would pick Public over all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Public Chicago”
Reviews.Author: gmweber
Reviews.Content: We recently spent an night in the newly renovated Public Chicago and loved the hotel. The service was fantastic, our room was upgraded when we requrested not to be located right next to the evevator and the room was refreshingly not like an older hotel. We had a very nice refrigerator/ bar and the large flat screen TV was heaven for my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Great alterative to downtown hotels”
Reviews.Author: SF_intrepidwanderer
Reviews.Content: Glad to find the Public through the living social offer - I would stay here even without the offer. I was originally considering staying on the Magnificent Mile but much prefer this location. Great neighborhood that's just north of downtown but feels more local; the hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms comfortable and serene. Bar can be a bit of a 'scene' on a weekend evening but the staff seem friendly and helpful (no attitude here) and there have been surprisingly few kinks considering they're still in the soft launch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, need to wok out some kinks”
Reviews.Author: omahamouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a corner suite (soft) opening weekend. Great service, always responded to every request quickly. Just needed to tweak some things: * The all white decor is overwhelming. Maybe a bright painting and a few colored throw pillows would help. * If you are going to supply candles in the living and bedroom areas, supply matches or lighters. * a mini bar but no glasses? * the lighting in the bathroom and vanity area are horrendous (coming from a woman!). They probably didn't want to mess with wiring in an old hotel, but seriously that horrible ambient yellow light is ridiculous to apply makeup in!! Overall, a great hotel. The rooms were huge, bed comfy (low platform bed, hard to get out of for older people maybe!), and amazing service. The room seemed "cool" and we loved the floor to ceiling curtains around the room. I went with 3 friends and we felt like we were rockstars with this amazing room and the staff falling all over to help us (hope they keep that up!). There seemed to be a lot of extra staff, but it was opening weekend so that might change. Our room didn't get cleaned on Saturday until almost 6:00 (even though we told the desk we were going out at noon and asked of it to be cleaned while we were gone). Great location in a ritzy area (Gold Coast) within walking distance to shopping, bars and restaurants.
